result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Pastorello

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: It is ordered that Attorney Jay Heit is withdrawn as counsel.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone, including defendant's children: C.P., S.P., E.P., N.P. 
No contact with C.P. alone.
Defendant not to discuss the facts of the case with C.P.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

10:29 AM case called. Defendant Daniel J Pastorello in court.  Attorney Jay E. Heit in court for Daniel J Pastorello.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense addresses the motion to withdraw. Defense would like to withdraw as counsel. Court has a colloquy with defendant regarding the Defense's request to withdraw. 
Court grants Attorney Heit to withdraw from the case. Court has a colloquy with the defendant regarding new counsel. Defendant would like to waive his right to an attorney for today's hearing. 
Court finds defendant has waived his right to an attorney for today's hearing knowingly and voluntarily. 
Court denies defendant's request to record today's hearing. Court has a colloquy with person in courtroom who was recording today's proceedings. 
Parties address the motion to dismiss Count 1. 
Defendant argues motion to dismiss. State argues against the Defense's motion to dismiss. 
Defense responds. Court denies the Defense's motion to dismiss Count 1. 
Parties address motion to suppress evidence. Court has colloquy with defendant regarding their statements  and cautions defendant that they could be used against them. 
Defense makes a statement and argues in support of the motion to suppress. 
State argues against the motion to suppress. Court denies the motion to suppress with explanation. 
Defendant makes a statement regarding the arrest and requests a new judge. 
Parties discuss the timeliness of the request and it is determined the defendant can request a new judge. 
Court grants the defendant's request for a new judge. 
Court's motion to address the bond: 
Court proposes new bond conditions. State's position has not changed. 
Court modifies bond to allow contact with defendant's children. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 11/7/22 AT 2:30 PM. 
Return to court: 11/29/22 at 9:30 am.
Non-party correspondence from L.C. and Z.S. regarding defendant; taken at counter; copies given to all parties.
Motion and Proposed Order to Withdraw as Counsel

Victim C.P. appears and makes statement to court. Bond remains unchanged at this time.
